means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 费洛来源于中世纪英语及晚期古英语，含义是“伙伴，股东”(partner,shareholder)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"同事，伙伴"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: associate, companion, comrade, colleague, fellow, partner
means: associate ：普通用词，侧重指在利害关系上密切相关。
companion ：指陪伴他人的人，即同伴或陪伴。
comrade ：指具有共同的事业、利益关系相一致的人。
colleague ：一般用于对同事的正式称呼，基本上专用在职业关系上。
fellow ：多用复数形式，指一块住、生活或同行共事的人。
partner ：指事业中处于合伙关系的人，或指婚姻、游戏、跳舞中的另一方。

sentence.Network_en: A fellow doesn't last long on what he has done. He's got to keep on delivering as he goes along.--Carl Hubbell, Baseball Player
sentence.Network_cn: 靠过去完成的无法让人保有成功，必须在路上持续交出成绩。

sentence.Network_en: By all accounts, Rodger would appear to be a fine fellow.
She shared her daughter's disdain for her fellow countrymen.
sentence.Network_cn: 她和女儿都瞧不起自己的同胞。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English fēolaga 'a partner or colleague' (literally 'one who lays down money in a joint enterprise'), from Old Norse félagi, from fé 'cattle, property, money' + the Germanic base of lay

entry.def: You use fellow to describe people who are in the same situation as you, or people you feel you have something in common with.

example.ex: She discovered to her pleasure, a talent for making her fellow guests laugh...
example.tran: 她高兴地发现自己具备一种能把其他客人逗笑的才能。

example.ex: Even in jail, my fellow inmates treated me with kindness.
example.tran: 就算在监狱里，狱友们对我也很友善。

entry.def: A fellow is a man or boy.

example.ex: By all accounts, Rodger would appear to be a fine fellow.

entry.def: Your fellows are the people who you work with, do things with, or who are like you in some way.

example.ex: He stood out in terms of competence from all his fellows...
example.tran: 他在能力上远远胜过其他同事。

example.ex: People looked out for one another and were concerned about the welfare of their fellows.
example.tran: 人们守望相助，关心着彼此的幸福。

entry.def: A fellow of an academic or professional association is someone who is a specially elected member of it, usually because of their work or achievements or as a mark of honour.

example.ex: ...the fellows of the Zoological Society of London.

means.word_mean: 2. a person who is frequently in the company of another;
3. a person who is member of your class or profession;

sentences.sentence: "he sent e-mail to his fellow hackers"

means.word_mean: 4. an informal form of address for a man;
5. a man who is the lover of a girl or young woman;

sentences.sentence: "if I'd known he was her boyfriend I wouldn't have asked"

Sentence.sentence: I became aware of the trials of career-focused European woman a few years ago when I met a post-doctoral student from Germany who was then a visiting fellow at Johns Hopkins.
Jack White, the former front man of the White Stripes and an influential figure among fellow musicians, likes to make things difficult for himself.

means.word_mean: 男子; 小伙子, 家伙

sentences.en: I consider him to be a clever fellow.
sentences.cn: 我认为他是个聪明的小伙子。

means.word_mean: (大学的)研究员, (学术团体的)会员

sentences.en: Kehr is a fellow of the Royal Society.

means.word_mean: 同伴, 同志，同事；同辈；同类；配对物

sentences.en: Her fellows share her interest in computers.
sentences.cn: 她的同伴跟她一样对计算机感兴趣。

jushi.english: Every one of us saw through the fellow.
jushi.chinese: 我们每个人都认识到那家伙的真面目。

jushi.english: That young fellow seems to have a lot to say for himself.
jushi.chinese: 那年轻人似乎有的是话说。

jushi.english: Karl is a fellow of the Royal Society.
